intro: Jacquemontia rufovelutina, commonly known as the red velvet vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, velvety hairs, contributing to its common name. Jacquemontia rufovelutina thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
